ancestors.content:
Do voters care about #ClimateChange?

"The large majority of Americans would prefer government action on climate change, but that doesn't mean that they prioritize the issue when they're going into their polling place and voting."

A Pew poll says Americans put climate at low priority.
But it's not that simple.

https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/voters-care-climate-change-green-divides-election/story?id=112586833

account.note:
Climate-friendly cars that fit the planet and the budget - and the cello
Plus climate news

http://www.cellomomcars.com/

card.title: Do voters care about climate change? How going green divides this election
card.description: Both Democrats and Republicans rank climate change lower than other issues.

ancestors.content:
In this Pew poll, "Dealing with climate change" is #18 of 20 priorities Americans were asked about.
I think that's simply because few people have connected the dots between climate change and issues that they care about.

For instance, climate change has a huge toll on the economy, on healthcare costs, and it's worst for poor people of color.

https://www.pewresearch.org/politics/2024/02/29/americans-top-policy-priority-for-2024-strengthening-the-economy/

media_attachments.description: Percent Americans who say a given issue should be a top prioity for the President and Congress to address this year

card.title: Americans’ Top Policy Priority for 2024: Strengthening the Economy
card.description: Growing shares of Republicans rate immigration and terrorism as top priorities for the president and Congress this year.

descendants.content:
8 million environmental voters skipped the 2020 presidential election.

"Nathaniel Stinnett [of the #EnvironmentalVoterProject] explains why increasing voter participation is essential to advancing the climate movement and shows how his team is mobilizing millions of new environmental voters — without talking about #ClimateChange at all."

https://www.realclearenergy.org/video/2024/08/06/why_isnt_the_climate_movement_voting_1049861.html

descendants.content:
Want to help turn out the environmental vote?

Opportunities at the Environmental Voter Project includes phone banking to get out the vote in swing states.

https://www.environmentalvoter.org/

(Unfortunately for introverts like me, they already have enough people writing postcards to voters; I'm working to convince myself that my fear of climate change is bigger than my fear of talking to a stranger).

card.title: Environmental Voter Project
card.description: We identify inactive environmentalists and transform them into consistent voters to build the power of the environmental movement.

account.note:
I started on Mastodon when Twitter was bought by Musk.
I'm 75, married to Bill, who is 79 for 57 years this year, have a son and a deceased daughter. I'm anti-royalty and anti-celebrity, anti-capitalist and am a anarcho-syndicalist. I love live music from classical to opera to rock, R&B, pop, jazz, experimental, contemporary etc., reading, growing food and flowers, volunteer and seek a way to live sustainably. No God's, No Masters. Science is cool too.
I will vote Green. LONDON, England

descendants.content: @CelloMomOnCars I noticed this early on and I am afraid she is triangulating. This won't change my vote, of course, but makes me sad.

descendants.content:
@tmstreet

Did you read the article tho?
It says Harris doesn't *have* to emphasise her record or plans on climate change because everybody already knows that Trump is going to turn on the fossil fuel spigot on full blast, while she has helped put "Biden's" climate law in place.

descendants.content: @CelloMomOnCars This wasn't based on the article but the fact that she is running away from her anti fracking stance in Pennsylvania due to its heavy reliance on natural gas and fracking. I could not access the article. Yes, realpolitik probably demands this but it still makes me sad that we can't have a full throated endorsement on the climate crisis. We are also setting records in fossil fuel production despite the good things with respect to IRA, etc.

descendants.content:
@CelloMomOnCars I think Vote Forward is still looking for postcard and letter writers. It will not be focused just on environmental or climate issues, but they are a very strong organization focused on #GOTV in the swing states. They have a very user friendly system for volunteers.

https://votefwd.org/

#USpol #USpolitics #Voting

account.note:
Curious citizen of the world. I have hope and faith in the universe despite it all. #mindfulness #democracy #climate #InternationalAffairs #InternationalRelations #RuleOfLaw #justice

I boost things I find interesting, important or inspiring. Followers get a mix of #news from all over (mostly US and Asia, #Japan) and random things that bring me #joy

card.title: Vote Forward
card.description: Vote Forward volunteers send heartfelt handwritten letters to unregistered and low-propensity voters encouraging them to participate in our democracy. The letters have been shown to significantly boost voter turnout.
